DataElement.preferredName: Initial Diagnosis Resection Paraffin Embedded Tissue Available Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not paraffin embedded tissue is available from initial surgical resection at diagnosis (prior to any treatment).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: First Diagnosis Excision Paraffin Embedded Tissue Available
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ._Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin._The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

Property.preferredDefinition: Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.:The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.
The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
